name: Akroma, Angel of Wrath
oracle_text: Flying, first strike, vigilance, trample, haste, protection from black and from red
flavor_text: "No rest. No mercy. No matter what."

rulings.text: The “legend rule” cares about legendary permanents with the exact same English name. You can control Akroma, Angel of Wrath and Akroma, Angel of Fury at the same time.

name: Akroma's Devoted
oracle_text: Cleric creatures have vigilance.
flavor_text: Akroma asked for only one thing from her troops: unwavering, unconditional loyalty.

name: Aven Redeemer
oracle_text: Flying
{T}: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
flavor_text: Redeemers rise with the sun, and the spirits of the people rise with them.

name: Aven Warhawk
oracle_text: Amplify 1 (As this creature enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on it for each Bird and/or Soldier card you reveal in your hand.)
Flying

name: Beacon of Destiny
oracle_text: {T}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, that damage is dealt to Beacon of Destiny instead.
flavor_text: "We all borrowed life from the Ancestor to exist in this world. Today, I repay that debt."

name: Celestial Gatekeeper
oracle_text: Flying
When Celestial Gatekeeper dies, exile it, then return up to two target Bird and/or Cleric permanent cards from your graveyard to the battlefield.

rulings.text: You can choose to target this card as one of the two Bird and/or Cleric cards. If you do, it gets exiled and does not get returned to the battlefield.

name: Cloudreach Cavalry
oracle_text: As long as you control a Bird, Cloudreach Cavalry gets +2/+2 and has flying.
flavor_text: "It's easy to lose sight of hope until you gaze out from my vantage point."

name: Daru Mender
oracle_text: Morph {W} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Daru Mender is turned face up, regenerate target creature.

rulings.text: The trigger occurs when you use the Morph ability to turn the card face up, or when an effect turns it face up. It will not trigger on being revealed or on leaving the battlefield.

name: Daru Sanctifier
oracle_text: Morph {1}{W} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Daru Sanctifier is turned face up, destroy target enchantment.

rulings.text: The trigger occurs when you use the Morph ability to turn the card face up, or when an effect turns it face up. It will not trigger on being revealed or on leaving the battlefield.

oracle_text: Amplify 1 (As this creature enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on it for each Soldier card you reveal in your hand.)
{T}: Daru Stinger deals damage equal to the number of +1/+1 counters on it to target attacking or blocking creature.

name: Defender of the Order
oracle_text: Morph {W}{W} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Defender of the Order is turned face up, creatures you control get +0/+2 until end of turn.

rulings.text: The trigger occurs when you use the Morph ability to turn the card face up, or when an effect turns it face up. It will not trigger on being revealed or on leaving the battlefield.

name: Deftblade Elite
oracle_text: Provoke (Whenever this creature attacks, you may have target creature defending player controls untap and block it if able.)
{1}{W}: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by Deftblade Elite this turn.

name: Essence Sliver
oracle_text: Whenever a Sliver deals damage, its controller gains that much life.
flavor_text: The slivers would survive, even at the expense of every other creature on Otaria.

rulings.text: You only gain the life when the triggered ability resolves. If you are reduced to zero life before the ability resolves, you will lose before gaining the life.

Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn’t provide any additional benefit.
If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it’s no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

name: Gempalm Avenger
oracle_text: Cycling {2}{W} ({2}{W}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Gempalm Avenger, Soldier creatures get +1/+1 and gain first strike until end of turn.

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

When you cycle this card, first the cycling ability goes on the stack, then the triggered ability goes on the stack on top of it. The triggered ability will resolve before you draw a card from the cycling ability.

The cycling ability and the triggered ability are separate. If the triggered ability doesn’t resolve (due to being countered with Stifle, for example, or if all its targets have become illegal), the cycling ability will still resolve and you’ll draw a card.

name: Glowrider
oracle_text: Noncreature spells cost {1} more to cast.
flavor_text: "It is not yet time."

rulings.text: The trigger occurs when you use the Morph ability to turn the card face up, or when an effect turns it face up. It will not trigger on being revealed or on leaving the battlefield.

name: Planar Guide
oracle_text: {3}{W}, Exile Planar Guide: Exile all creatures. At the beginning of the next end step, return those cards to the battlefield under their owners' control.
flavor_text: "Every moment has its own savior."

rulings.text: All “enters the battlefield” abilities trigger as normal.
Creatures that were face down return to the battlefield face up.
If the ability is activated during the End step, then the creatures do not return until the End step of the following turn.

When the creatures leave the battlefield, all Auras on them go to their owners’ graveyards, any counters on them are removed, and effects on them end. Token creatures do not return to the battlefield.

name: Plated Sliver
oracle_text: All Sliver creatures get +0/+1.
flavor_text: Overcoming extinction has only made the slivers more determined to live.

rulings.text: Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn’t provide any additional benefit.
If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it’s no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

flavor_text: "Now that I have your attention, perhaps I can tell you of the Order."

rulings.text: If you use this ability on the same creature more than once, the cost is cumulative.

name: White Knight
oracle_text: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Protection from black (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything black.)
flavor_text: In the wretched depths of the Grand Coliseum, his soul shines like a single torch blazing in the night.

name: Windborn Muse
oracle_text: Flying
Creatures can't attack you unless their controller pays {2} for each creature they control that's attacking you.
flavor_text:
"Her voice is justice, clear and relentless."
—Akroma, angelic avenger

rulings.text: If you have more than one of these on the battlefield, the cost is cumulative.
In the Two-Headed Giant format, you still only have to pay once per creature.
Unless some effect explicitly says otherwise, a creature that can’t attack you can still attack a planeswalker you control.

name: Wingbeat Warrior
oracle_text: Flying
Morph {2}{W} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

name: Cephalid Pathmage
oracle_text: Cephalid Pathmage can't be blocked.
{T}, Sacrifice Cephalid Pathmage: Target creature can't be blocked this turn.
flavor_text: Pathmages can open doors that aren't even there.

name: Chromeshell Crab
oracle_text: Morph {4}{U} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Chromeshell Crab is turned face up, you may exchange control of target creature you control and target creature an opponent controls.

rulings.text: You choose the two target creatures when the triggered ability is put onto the stack. You do not have to choose Chromeshell Crab. You choose whether or not to do the exchange on resolution.
The exchange fails if either target is not still on the battlefield at that time.
The exchange fails if either you no longer control your creature or the other creature is now controlled by you.
The creatures can’t attack until you start a turn with them under your control. So you can’t swap and then attack.
The trigger occurs when you use the Morph ability to turn the card face up, or when an effect turns it face up. It will not trigger on being revealed or on leaving the battlefield.

name: Covert Operative
oracle_text: Covert Operative can't be blocked.
flavor_text: Some spies seek clarity. Others seek transparency.

name: Merchant of Secrets
oracle_text: When Merchant of Secrets enters the battlefield, draw a card.
flavor_text: To scrape out a living in Aphetto, wizards are reduced to selling rumors, lies, forgeries, or—if they get desperate enough—the truth.

name: Mistform Seaswift
oracle_text: Flying
{1}: Mistform Seaswift becomes the creature type of your choice until end of turn.
Morph {1}{U} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

name: Mistform Sliver
oracle_text: All Slivers have "{1}: This permanent becomes the creature type of your choice in addition to its other types until end of turn."
flavor_text: Taking the form of a junior researcher, the first sliver slipped out of Riptide.

rulings.text: Unlike most type changing effects, this one adds a creature type instead of replacing existing creature types.

Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn’t provide any additional benefit.
If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it’s no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

name: Mistform Ultimus
oracle_text: Mistform Ultimus is every creature type (even if this card isn't on the battlefield).
flavor_text: It may wear your face, but its mind is its own.

rulings.text: The type “Illusion” is printed on the card’s type line purely for flavor. The Ultimus has every other creature type as well.
Like any creature, if Mistform Ultimus becomes another type as the result of a spell or ability, it will lose all its other creature types.
Mistform Ultimus has all creature types even if an effect removes its ability. Type-changing static abilities will apply in layer 4 before effects such as Sudden Spoiling’s remove them in layer 6.

name: Mistform Wakecaster
oracle_text: Flying
{1}: Mistform Wakecaster becomes the creature type of your choice until end of turn.
{2}{U}{U}, {T}: Choose a creature type. Each creature you control becomes that type until end of turn.

name: Primoc Escapee
oracle_text: Flying
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
flavor_text: Though a completely artificial species, primocs are a natural fit for the skies of Otaria.

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

name: Riptide Director
oracle_text: {2}{U}{U}, {T}: Draw a card for each Wizard you control.
flavor_text: Those who lead others to wisdom become the wisest themselves.

name: Riptide Mangler
oracle_text: {1}{U}: Change Riptide Mangler's base power to target creature's power. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
flavor_text: It wants you to be its chum.

rulings.text: The activated ability overwrites all previous effects that set Riptide Mangler’s base power to specific a value (such as previous activations of the ability). Other effects that set its base power that start to apply after Riptide Mangler’s ability resolves will overwrite this effect.

Effects that modify Riptide Mangler’s power, such as the effect of Giant Growth or Glorious Anthem, will apply to Riptide Mangler no matter when they started applying. The same is true for counters that affect Riptide Mangler’s power and effects that switch its power and toughness.

name: Shifting Sliver
oracle_text: Slivers can't be blocked except by Slivers.
flavor_text: Once the last few slivers the Riptide Project controlled were dead, there was nothing to keep the island from being completely overrun.

rulings.text: Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn’t provide any additional benefit.
If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it’s no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

flavor_text:
"Species XR17 feeds upon the mental energies of its victims. This explains why the goblins remain unaffected."
—Riptide Project researcher

rulings.text: Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn’t provide any additional benefit.
If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it’s no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

name: Voidmage Apprentice
oracle_text: Morph {2}{U}{U} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Voidmage Apprentice is turned face up, counter target spell.

rulings.text: The trigger occurs when you use the Morph ability to turn the card face up, or when an effect turns it face up. It will not trigger on being revealed or on leaving the battlefield.

If a spell with split second is on the stack, you can still respond by turning this creature face up and targeting that spell with the trigger. This is because split second only stops players from casting spells or activating abilities, while turning a creature face up is a special action.

name: Wall of Deceit
oracle_text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{3}: Turn Wall of Deceit face down.
Morph {U} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

name: Warped Researcher
oracle_text: Whenever a player cycles a card, Warped Researcher gains flying and shroud until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
flavor_text: New insights yield new senses.

rulings.text: On your turn, an opponent can cycle a card that has a cycling triggered ability and target this card with that ability. This works on your turn because your triggered abilities go on the stack first, so your opponent’s ability will resolve before yours. This situation is reversed on your opponent’s turn.

name: Weaver of Lies
oracle_text: Morph {4}{U} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Weaver of Lies is turned face up, turn any number of target creatures with morph abilities other than Weaver of Lies face down.

rulings.text: The trigger occurs when you use the Morph ability to turn the card face up, or when an effect turns it face up. It will not trigger on being revealed or on leaving the battlefield.

name: Willbender
oracle_text: Morph {1}{U} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Willbender is turned face up, change the target of target spell or ability with a single target.

rulings.text: The trigger occurs when you use the Morph ability to turn the card face up, or when an effect turns it face up. It will not trigger on being revealed or on leaving the battlefield.

If a spell with split second is on the stack, you can still respond by turning this creature face up and targeting that spell with the trigger. This is because split second only stops players from casting spells or activating abilities, while turning a creature face up is a special action.

You don’t choose the new target for the spell until Willbender’s triggered ability resolves. You must change the target if possible. However, you can’t change the target to an illegal target. If there are no legal targets to choose from, the target isn’t changed. It doesn’t matter if the original target of that spell has somehow become illegal itself.
If a spell or ability targets multiple things, you can’t target it with Willbender’s triggered ability, even if all but one of those targets have become illegal.
If a spell or ability targets the same player or object multiple times, you can’t target it with Willbender’s ability.

name: Aphetto Exterminator
oracle_text: Morph {3}{B} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Aphetto Exterminator is turned face up, target creature gets -3/-3 until end of turn.

rulings.text: The trigger occurs when you use the Morph ability to turn the card face up, or when an effect turns it face up. It will not trigger on being revealed or on leaving the battlefield.

name: Bane of the Living
oracle_text: Morph {X}{B}{B} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Bane of the Living is turned face up, all creatures get -X/-X until end of turn.

rulings.text: The trigger occurs when you use the Morph ability to turn the card face up, or when an effect turns it face up. It will not trigger on being revealed or on leaving the battlefield.
The X in the ability has the same value as the X paid in the Morph ability. This is pretty easy to derive since there is no other source of X.

name: Blood Celebrant
oracle_text: {B}, Pay 1 life: Add one mana of any color.
flavor_text:

rulings.text: You do not have to find a Zombie card or swamp card if you do not want to, even if you have them in your library.

rulings.text: Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn’t provide any additional benefit.

You only shuffle your library if you choose to search it.

Whenever Drinker of Sorrow deals combat damage, sacrifice a permanent.

rulings.text: You only sacrifice one permanent, no matter how many things it deals damage to.

name: Dripping Dead
oracle_text: Dripping Dead can't block.
Whenever Dripping Dead deals combat damage to a creature, destroy that creature. It can't be regenerated.
flavor_text: It oozes death from every pore.

name: Earthblighter
oracle_text: {2}{B}, {T}, Sacrifice a Goblin: Destroy target land.
flavor_text: "A single dedicated mind can bring about the greatest destruction. That, or goblins—goblins work too."

name: Embalmed Brawler
oracle_text: Amplify 1 (As this creature enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on it for each Zombie card you reveal in your hand.)
Whenever Embalmed Brawler attacks or blocks, you lose 1 life for each +1/+1 counter on it.

name: Gempalm Polluter
oracle_text: Cycling {B}{B} ({B}{B}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Gempalm Polluter, you may have target player lose life equal to the number of Zombies on the battlefield.

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

When you cycle this card, first the cycling ability goes on the stack, then the triggered ability goes on the stack on top of it. The triggered ability will resolve before you draw a card from the cycling ability.

The cycling ability and the triggered ability are separate. If the triggered ability doesn’t resolve (due to being countered with Stifle, for example, or if all its targets have become illegal), the cycling ability will still resolve and you’ll draw a card.
You can cycle this card even if there are no targets for the triggered ability. That’s because the cycling ability itself has no targets.

name: Ghastly Remains
oracle_text: Amplify 1 (As this creature enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on it for each Zombie card you reveal in your hand.)

name: Hollow Specter

Whenever Hollow Specter deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {X}. If you do, that player reveals X cards from their hand and you choose one of them. That player discards that card.

X can be zero, but then that player discards nothing.

name: Infernal Caretaker
oracle_text: Morph {3}{B} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Infernal Caretaker is turned face up, return all Zombie cards from all graveyards to their owners' hands.

rulings.text: The trigger occurs when you use the Morph ability to turn the card face up, or when an effect turns it face up. It will not trigger on being revealed or on leaving the battlefield.

name: Noxious Ghoul
oracle_text: Whenever Noxious Ghoul or another Zombie enters the battlefield, all non-Zombie creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.
flavor_text: Plague and death wrapped in one convenient package.

name: Phage the Untouchable
oracle_text: When Phage the Untouchable enters the battlefield, if you didn't cast it from your hand, you lose the game.
Whenever Phage deals combat damage to a creature, destroy that creature. It can't be regenerated.
Whenever Phage deals combat damage to a player, that player loses the game.

rulings.text: It is only considered “cast from your hand” if you cast it as a spell from your hand. Putting it onto the battlefield from your hand using a spell or ability will cause you to lose the game.
In a Commander game where this card is your commander, casting it from the Command zone does not count as casting it from your hand.

name: Scion of Darkness
oracle_text: Trample
Whenever Scion of Darkness deals combat damage to a player, you may put target creature card from that player's graveyard onto the battlefield under your control.
Cycling {3} ({3}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

rulings.text: If this card destroys a creature in combat and at the same time (using its Trample ability) it damages a player, you will be able to target the destroyed creature (if it was a card and not a token) to be brought back.

Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

name: Skinthinner
oracle_text: Morph {3}{B}{B} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Skinthinner is turned face up, destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

rulings.text: The trigger occurs when you use the Morph ability to turn the card face up, or when an effect turns it face up. It will not trigger on being revealed or on leaving the battlefield.

name: Smokespew Invoker
oracle_text: {7}{B}: Target creature gets -3/-3 until end of turn.
flavor_text: The Mirari festers in its flesh.

name: Sootfeather Flock
oracle_text: Flying
Morph {3}{B} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
flavor_text: They pick at the remains of the city's corpse.

name: Spectral Sliver
oracle_text: All Sliver creatures have "{2}: This creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn."
flavor_text:
"Sure, I've seen agents of the Cabal here and there. Well, not here, and certainly not in any of the sliver labs. Oh dear, I've said too much."
—Apprentice researcher

rulings.text: Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn’t provide any additional benefit.
If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it’s no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

name: Toxin Sliver
oracle_text: Whenever a Sliver deals combat damage to a creature, destroy that creature. It can't be regenerated.
flavor_text: It doesn't need to use its venom—it just needs you to know it can.

If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it’s no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

name: Frenetic Raptor
oracle_text: Beasts can't block.
flavor_text:
"How do you stop a raptor from charging? No, seriously Help"
—Blarg, goblin jester

name: Gempalm Incinerator
oracle_text: Cycling {1}{R} ({1}{R}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Gempalm Incinerator, you may have it deal X damage to target creature, where X is the number of Goblins on the battlefield.

rulings.text: The target of the ability can’t be a creature with Protection from Creatures, with Protection from Goblins, or with Protection from Red.

Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

When you cycle this card, first the cycling ability goes on the stack, then the triggered ability goes on the stack on top of it. The triggered ability will resolve before you draw a card from the cycling ability.

The cycling ability and the triggered ability are separate. If the triggered ability doesn’t resolve (due to being countered with Stifle, for example, or if all its targets have become illegal), the cycling ability will still resolve and you’ll draw a card.
You can cycle this card even if there are no targets for the triggered ability. That’s because the cycling ability itself has no targets.

name: Goblin Assassin
oracle_text: Whenever Goblin Assassin or another Goblin enters the battlefield, each player flips a coin. Each player whose coin comes up tails sacrifices a creature.
flavor_text: The more victims he kills, the more likely he is to get the right one.

rulings.text: This coin flip has no winner or loser.

name: Goblin Clearcutter
oracle_text: {T}, Sacrifice a Forest: Add three mana in any combination of {R} and/or {G}.
flavor_text:
"Did you know that wood burns even better than rocks?"
—Toggo, goblin weaponsmith

rulings.text: The ability can grant {G}{G}{G}, {R}{G}{G}, {R}{R}{G}, or {R}{R}{R}.

name: Goblin Dynamo
oracle_text: {T}: Goblin Dynamo deals 1 damage to any target.
{X}{R}, {T}, Sacrifice Goblin Dynamo: It deals X damage to any target.

name: Goblin Firebug

rulings.text: You do not have to find a Dragon card if you do not want to, even if you have one in your library.

oracle_text: Morph {X}{X}{R} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

rulings.text: The trigger occurs when you use the Morph ability to turn the card face up, or when an effect turns it face up. It will not trigger on being revealed or on leaving the battlefield.
The X in the ability has the same value as the X paid in the Morph ability. This is pretty easy to derive since there is no other source of X.

rulings.text: The first ability applies when this card is not on the battlefield. The second ability applies when this card is on the battlefield.

Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn’t provide any additional benefit.

rulings.text: The first ability applies when this card is not on the battlefield. The second ability applies when this card is on the battlefield.

Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn’t provide any additional benefit.
If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it’s no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

name: Seedborn Muse
oracle_text: Untap all permanents you control during each other player's untap step.
flavor_text:
"Her voice is wilderness, savage and pure."
—Kamahl, druid acolyte

rulings.text: Other effects can prevent a permanent from untapping during an untap step. You do need to look carefully, however, as many effects say that the permanent does not untap during its controller’s untap step, and this card’s ability occurs during other players’ untap steps. If a card does say this, then Seedborn Muse can untap it. But some other abilities are not written this way and can still prevent a card from untapping.
All your permanents untap during each other player’s untap step. You have no choice about what untaps.

name: Stonewood Invoker
oracle_text: {7}{G}: Stonewood Invoker gets +5/+5 until end of turn.
flavor_text: The Mirari pulses in his veins.

name: Timberwatch Elf
oracle_text: {T}: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of Elves on the battlefield.

rulings.text: The number of Elves on the battlefield is counted only as Timberwatch Elf’s ability resolves. If Timberwatch Elf is still on the battlefield, it’ll count itself.
